results.name: The least k > 0 such that the arithmetic derivative of n+k is a multiple of the arithmetic derivative of n.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..16385
Antti Karttunen, Data supplement: n, a(n) computed for n = 2..65537
example: Arithmetic derivative of 6 is A003415(6) = 5. Not until at k=21 we find another number whose arithmetic derivative is a multiple of five (as A003415(21) = 10 = 2*5), thus a(6) = 21-6 = 15.
xref: Cf. A003415, A328236, A328237 (gives the quotient).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 08 2019
